title: Oil prices slip as wary traders eye upcoming OPEC+ meeting
text: Oil prices fell nearly 1% on Monday as traders hedged bets with the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) considering meeting as soon as this week to discuss whether to extend record production cuts beyond end-June.

title: Asia cautious as U.S. riots weigh on S&P futures
text: Asian share markets started on a cautious note and gold gained on Monday as images of riots in burning U.S. cities unnerved investors already tense over Washington's power struggle with Beijing.

title: Dow futures fall Sunday evening after weekend of violent protests amid coronavirus pandemic
text: U.S. stock-index futures headed south in thin trading Sunday evening following a weekend of violent protests over the death of a black man, George Floyd, early last week in Minneapolis while in policy custody.

title: America’s Oil And Natural Gas Investments Must Continue Apace
text: As our energy-environment discussion continues amid the pandemic, one of our biggest concerns must be that temporary fallen demand and lower prices discourage fewer investments in new oil and natural gas supply. We must not allow this to happen.

title: Dow futures fall 200 points, with Wall Street set to give back some of May's strong gains
text: U.S. stock futures fell on Sunday night as Wall Street was set to kick off June trading on a sour note after consecutive monthly gains.

title: Dow futures fall more than 200 points Sunday evening after weekend of violent protests amid coronavirus pandemic

title: Investors are dangerously downplaying coronavirus and trade risks, Wilmington Trust's Meghan Shue warns

title: 5 Reasons The Stock Market Is Poised For A Selloff
text: U.S. Stock Market Trading Outlook (3-5 Days):  Bearish I expect US stock markets have begun a short-term topping process that should result in a 5 percent decline in stocks into early or mid-June. I plan to sell into strength over the short-term.

title: May Monthly Stock Market Update and Economic Commentary
text: Stocks rose sharply in May with the S&P 500 Index INDEXSP: .INX gaining 4.5% while the Dow Jones Industrial Average added 4.3%. The NASDAQ Composite INDEXNASDAQ: .IXIC rose 6.8% and the Russell climbed nearly 7%.

title: Is the Recent Stock Market Rally a Sign of Strength or Reaction to Weakness?

title: S&P 500 Again Tops 3,000: Are New Highs Next?
text: It was another good week in the market last week, with strong advance/decline numbers and widespread optimism in the economic recovery. Tom explores what this means for market risk and investor sentiment as we head into June.

title: Russia has no objection to earlier OPEC+ meeting: sources
text: Russia has no objection to the next meeting of OPEC and its allies, known as OPEC+, being brought forward to June 4 from the following week, three OPEC+ sources familiar with the meeting's preparations told Reuters on Sunday.

title: Top 10 Charts & Graphs Heading Into June 2020: S&P 500, Gold, Oil, Tesla, Canopy & More

title: What to expect in the week ahead? China trade war and earnings in focus
text: U.S. President Donald Trump was expected to signal a new trade war with China during his Friday press conference. But his comments fell shy of any worst-case scenario and the S&P 500 index finished the day higher by nearly 0.5%.

text: America can be re-built, and it can be as prosperous as it once was. But it will need visionary leadership.

title: Investors eye consumer discretionary stocks as U.S. reopens
